name: Dar Julkowski
text: Great service and delicious pizza! When I couldn't decide what to get, my server recommended I try half of both.  I did and ordered half/half Veg Out and Kosmic Karma pizzas. They were both delicious! Fresh ingredients and great hippie vibe ‚úåüèºüíúüçï

name: Sheila Harmon
text: Great reminiscing atmosphere for those graduating in the 70's! The magical mystery tour definitely took it's away. The wait staff was very professional, friendly and jovial. Italian fare, I had calzone which was excellent, enough for 2, so l had to take 1/2 of it home!

name: Disa Javon
text: I wish I could go back in time and not visit this restaurant! I have a Mellow Mushroom in my hometown and while visiting the Chapel Hill area I decided to go to someplace familiar. It absolutely was not! My pizza was burnt the service was ‚Ä¶More

name: Shannon Harris
text: Hadn't been here in a good while, but I finally went back to meet up with a friend the other day. Service was great, our waitress was super friendly. Pizza was made quickly and was delicious. Honestly I have nothing bad to say about this experience and will definitely return.

name: ankush grover
text: Funky, fun interiors; diverse menu that offers everything from pizzas, pies, calzones, hoagies etc; enough veggie options & Their breads are extremely fresh & very light!

name: Jeff Schmidt
text: Excellent pizza and service! Fun atmosphere.

name: Ian Triplett
text: I've been to other locations and I'm always happy with what I get. Personally I've been a bit hesitant in going to restaurants that advertise artisan pizza because I find that the mark is missed in some fashion. Not at mellow mushroom - the ‚Ä¶More

name: Jesse Safir
text: We LOVE this place! We love the decorations and the pizza is one of the best in town. We especially love the Mega Veggie with tofu and vegan cheese and the Holy Shiitake with vegan cheese. The kids also love eating in the bus!

name: Scott Watkins
text: Great service, cool location. Big garage doors in the bar, open when the weather is good.

name: Anna B
text: Pizza was good but the sevice was so bad. But that's pretty much every Mellow that I've been to. It seems like to be employed here you first have to swear an oath to be extremely preoccupied by all things other than your customers. Maybe too Mellow?

name: Jenny Stilley
text: Excellent service (were lookin at you, Justin F). Great location. Will come back again the next time we are in town.

name: Jennifer Freeman
text:
Great food.  Very speedy service for a Friday.

Our visit was marred by one really appallingly unprofessional server who needed ‚Ä¶More

name: Bryan Kinsella
text: Pizza was above average. Super busy and they lost my phone order so even though my pizzas were done they had been sitting on the top of the oven for a long time. Very frustrating. Cool interior. Parking is not bad and free but it's in the ‚Ä¶More

name: EC
text: Mellow mushroom has a lot of interesting pizzas to offer. For me their strongest point is their crust which is a cut above your average pizza chain like Dominos or Pizza Hut. The crust is crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside the ‚Ä¶More

name: Travis Smith
text: Went out with my family and had a wonderful experience. Great management from Kyle and his team! Exceeded all of our expectations with wonderful food, great service and a happy atmosphere. The best mellow mushroom we have visited.

name: Michael Stuart
text: The food was great and the staff went out of their way with helping my handicapped father. ‚Ä¶More

name: Justin Finkelstein
text: Food was OK. I had the mushroom soup and a small house special pizza. The soup was OK, but had way too much cheese in so I could barely taste mushroom and the pizza had just far too many toppings. Nicely baked though. I'd eat here again, but coose something a little less complicated.

name: Adam DePrimo
text: As far as mellow mushrooms go, this is pretty standard. But the service is always great and it's Tar Heel/Chapel Hill centric, so that's a plus. Pretty cool mural outside as well with of street, dedicated patron parking.

name: Dillon Bolding
text: We had a party of 10 or so, and our server - (I really wish I remembered her name) - treated us so well. The pizza was good and the atmosphere is nice. They have a parking lot behind the restaurant, which is convenient! But be sure not to ‚Ä¶More

name: Onthego Burrell
text: Magical Mushroom soup was just that. We enjoyed the 2 pizzas we tried and they had a nice beer selection. Will definitely be back.

name: William Boyd
text: Great place for party. Good steak and cheese sandwich

name: Johnnetta Brown
text: Always enjoy eating at Mellow Mushrooms in downtown Chapel Hill during the all you can eat buffet. The holy Shiitake is the best pizza I've ever experienced. üëçüëçüëçüëçüëç

name: Jen Gad
text: Totally love their gluten free pizza, which is better quality and cheeper than the Domino's gluten free. They even have vegan cheese! Downtown Chapel Hill location is super convenient.

name: JP Christensen
text: Great pizza!  The red potato pie is my ultimate favorite pizza. Highly recommend the meat balls and based on the tap rotation they can have really good beer too.

name: Jax Guthrie
text: The staff was very uneducated about service dogs, which caused problems as soon as we walked in the door. They told us dogs weren't allowed, we specified that he was a service dog. They once again denied us, saying no dogs, and we got more ‚Ä¶More

name: Lilibeth Serrano
text: The pesto pizza was great. The server gave us a free cinnamon pretzel as a birthday gift to someone at our table. That was unexpected and very kind.

name: Ariana Green
text: This location has great service and even better food! The atmosphere was welcoming and the decor is funky!!

name: Brad Branson
text: 5 stars everytime. Food is delicious.  üòã service is always on point. Place is clean the environment and music,  is 2nd to none! I will return here. Make sure you do to.

name: David Diemer
text: This is the first time visiting this fine location and we thoroughly enjoyed the food (Mighty Meaty pizza, and garlic cheese bread). The service was excellent. ‚Ä¶More

name: Miranda McCraw
text: One of my favorite places to eat on Earth! Friendly staff, good drink selection, and absolutely delicious pizza! Lunch buffet is also good.

name: Shahab Siahpoosh
text: Their vegan cheese is one of the best I have tried. Priced Right. Their location is great too, but some evenings it gets too crowded.

name: Samantha Anderson
text: Come here now and again. Last night was extra fantastic. Food and staff was on their best game!

name: J R
text: Good solid chain serving well done "americanized" pizza options. Good chewy crust that is surprisingly not greasy. Pleasant friendly casual service. Reasonable prices and good appetizer options. Great drink specials and lunch pizza pricing as well.

name: Ben Robbins
text: The pizza is always delicious. The beer selection is solid and ever evolving. The patio is great for some people watching as well. They have parking in the back.

name: Jack Warren
text: Restaurant had maybe 6 couples and singles on the whole place. Guy working the line noticed us twice before waitress or manager ever did. Waited at the front for more than 5 minutes (please wait sign was up) before waitress could break away ‚Ä¶More

name: sebastian maseko
text: Some of the best pizza I've had in a while , very delicious. A large pizza here can feed a small village üòé

name: Martha Farnham
text: Fun place, service was okay. Ordered a vegan cheese and it was pretty good.

name: Mike Holland
text: Enjoy this chain every time I have been to other locations. Tried lunch buffet today, the quality was shockingly low and when brought it up to staff...it was just "how it is sorry"... Great chain but avoid this one.

name: Rose Labriola
text: This is a great place for eclectic pizza.  Staff was attentive and kind.  The place was a retro throw back.  Prices are a tad high but worth it for the product.  There was plenty of room for a big family gathering on the other side of the ‚Ä¶More

name: Forest Schweitzer
text: Really nice basically every time. I went vegan recently and discovered that they actually have vegan cheese they will sub on any pizza. It wasn't as good as the regular cheese, but certainly not bad either. Delicious pizza without breaking the bank!

name: Kim Donica
text: Reliable local chain. Good for a group. It isn't great pizza in the wood fired or trendy sense but there isn't anything to complain about either. It is delicious and everyone in your group will find something appealing. Vegetarian options, including terrific sandwiches

name: Larry Gottschalk
text: Pretty decent pies. Too much bread (crust thickness and edge size) though. Best fresh at the table, not ideal reheated or cold. Pretty pricey too, but pizza is, these days. Always a super-friendly staff.

name: April
text: They have great vegan pizzas and garlic bread can be made vegan. Just wish they had vegan Ranch for the salads and some mock meats.

name: Driven_Seeker
text: Best pizza ever, as always! The service was great, really friendly and cheerful. And we were served and seated amazingly fast, considering it was Friday night. 10 out of 10 will definitely go again.

name: Brandy Bell
text: Not a fan, but I think that is just my own personal taste. The staff is really friendly. The restaurant is really cool inside.

name: Liz Sheffield
text: Great service and excellent gluten free options

name: Reed Palmer
text: Amongst the best pizza in Chapel Hill, if not the best. Great crust. Love the House Special.

name: Rob Byron
text: Best cheese steak sandwich ever. Great service

name: Grace Fox
text: Staff is always super friendly and pizza is consistently delicious.    One of the few places on Franklin Street with their own parking lot (off Rosemary) which makes it easy for us a family to visit.

name: Kevin Parker
text: First timer but not last timer. Very good food and service

name: Joseph McKenna
text: The food is delicious and the service exceptional.

name: Ben Brenner
text: The price was right. The pizza buffet had plenty of selection including vegetarian. The salad bar was fresh and delicious. The crust on the pizza was a little greasy and tasted like baking soda.

name: Chuck P
text: Avoid the buffet. Can't keep cheese pizza out and regular pepperoni is scarce. Just go alacarte. Decided to give them a try at the buffet but a big fail in my book. Keep it premium. Taste is always decent though.

name: Nazar Filonov
text: Mellow Mushroom Pizza Bakers was founded in 1974 in Atlanta, Georgia. The franchise, operated under Home-Grown Industries of Georgia, Inc., is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. For over 40 years, Mellow Mushroom Pizza Bakers has been serving up fresh, stone-baked pizzas. Each Mellow is locally owned and operated

name: Mickey Sartin
text: Always good.    Each location has its own little bit of variation in atmosphere and menu.   Not a place to go when you're looking for lighter fare.

name: Sarah
text: Really good and friendly service! Wish they had the mega Veggie pizza though

name: Andrea Freeman
text: Pizza was amazing definitely going back.

name: Frankstar
text: weird dude came out and confronted about a review don't think i'll be going back #birdchest #papajohns

name: Denise Carrillo
text: Did the pizza lunch buffet. Only 4 choices. Nothing to write home about. Waitress almost knocked me over because she was too busy texting on her cell to see me walking back from the buffet.

name: Laurie Burch
text: The staff was delightful and the food was Delicious!  One small part of the meal arrived incorrect but was fixed immediately.  Loved Carrie, our waitress.

name: Ron Mattera
text: Good food service and parking

name: Ashley Sullivan
text: Nicest Mellow Mushroom in NC. Just second to the one in Asheville! No just kidding both those restaurants are superb.  You guys rock! Rock! üòò

name: Damon H
text: I love the pizza at Mellow Mushroom.  Heres a not widely known fact: the Chapel Hill location has a pretty great lunch buffet. Just sayin'.

name: Udo Rodemann
text: Great waiter "Precise" for positive interaction with guests. Food did not come up to same level of "performance. "

name: Naike Cristancho
text: the best organic pizza, excellent service

name: Brandon Wohlfarth
text: To be quite honest with this place they do cook good pizza but the cheese steak my fiance had here was horrible. It literally had no flavor. Now I know this is coming from a pizza place but if it can't be cooked properly please take it off ‚Ä¶More

name: Jeromy Rech
text: Overall, great place to get a pizza. Only reason for the 4 star instead of 5 is the crust. If you get a large, it is to hard to hold so you really need to use a knife and fork.

name: Brad Buchanan
text: Very quick, kind and helpful waitstaff, super vegan-friendly!

name: Sarah
text: Coolest MM I‚Äôve seen yet. Awesome waitress and delicious as always!

name: Len Raleigh
text: It's the mellow mushroom! Awesome gourmet pizza! As others has said there is no parking lot. Every mellow mushroom is different. i was only here for a quick lunch but when I get deeper inside and grab a pizza I'll updatethis to a more thorough review. You have got to love the mellow mushroom though!

name: An Da
text: Ordered small mushroom medley and sausage pizza. Quality stuff. Super tasty. Fun atmosphere. Good for kids.

name: remafri 88
text: Great pizza! I love their sausage and mushroom pizza. Their side salad is a nice size, and great chicken wings!

name: kearny davis
text: Friends coming over, ordered online at 5:10 for pickup at 6:45.  Got there and chaos with about 15 people standing in line.  I asked the wait staff 4 times to check on order and they said running a little behind and should be ready soon.  Finally at 7:30 they find my order, its cold, but ready.

name: Kyle Barnes
text: The staff is wonderful  the food is great, and the service is fast! Love love love the loaded potato pie and bruschetta.

name: Abbi H
text: Great gluten free pizza! The crust tasted great! The whole atmosphere of the restaurant was super fun!

name: Jason Wares
text: Great Food, Great Service. My kids favorite place!

name: J Britney Pendleton
text: Parking is a little bit of a pain, but that can't be helped. Pizza and service were great.

name: Julio Ramirez
text: I was there for lunch, and their buffet was amazing. Love the vibe and the food is always on point.

name: rajjar52
text: Excellent food and service as always!

name: Jesse Wojdylo
text: I have only been to Mellow Mushroom in Chapel Hill once but it was amazing.  The mighty meaty is always a good choice for anyone who likes a little bit of bacon and ham on their pizza.  The atmosphere is quite interesting but the parking is ‚Ä¶More

name: Kevin Kolbe
text: Probably my favorite pizza...period. Fresh ingredients. Fantastic crust. And if you don't like pizza, they've got lots of other goodies too.

name: Rob
text: Great pizza selection, the sizes are worth the prices but food was good and the customer service amazing

name: Kelly Flegal
text: This location is great. The staff are very friendly, the service was very fast, and the calzones are delicious. I love that MM has vegan options, which is a big reason I get my pizza and calzones here.

name: Brad Hunter
text: Amazing pizza and salads! Pretzel apps are the best!

name: Thomas Farrer
text: Some of the best pizza you'll ever have.

name: James Bankoski
text: Great salad options!

name: Soumaya Lansari
text: The staff is very friendly, their food is great, and I've always had a great time whenever I've visited!

name: George Simons
text: Great pizza. Fun staff. Good place to refuel after a football game.

name: Bug Lorynn
text: The best MM in the triangle. The staff truly care about making your experience amazing. My favorite pizza is the Kosmic Karma , (vegetarian) try it with fresh basil added. So good!!! Or ask your server for their suggestions. They really ‚Ä¶More

name: Jam Horn
text: Good but not great

name: Randy Josey
text: I have had better pizzz

name: Catey Christiansen
text: My son had an excellent birthday celebration here. Staff was great.

name: Mister J
text: The service was attentive and very friendly. Steak and cheese sub was awesome and price reasonable!

name: nicole carrington
text: Use to have great pizza until they changed their pizza dough. The dough is very very very thin now. The pizza was not good at all!!!! I also had a reaction from the new dough. Never eating here again unless the go back to the gluten free dough they had before.

name: Qingwei Cheng
text: Really chill place, recommend

name: Peyton Lewis
text: Had Veggie Pizza; very good!

name: Kingpin
text: Good pizza.

name: Frankie Allah
text: Sike rather eat a digorno pizza

name: TTV Cooper
text: Awesome food and the bartender was incredible! I will be back many more times just because of her. Her name is Liz

name: Tilly Pick
text: Awesome lunch spot!

name: Brittany Harrison
text: Good pizza! Great service. Can be hard to find parking though.

name: D Scott
text: I recommend ordering out. The pizzas are good, some great. Getting a table means longer waits, which makes me want a beer but the selection is poor and prices high.

name: Kat
text: Delicious food, GREAT service!

name: Natan Carvalho
text: Food is great as always but they are the slowest MM I‚Äôve ever been in my whole life. Do not eat here unless you have more than one hour to eat your meal.

name: Donald Sizemore II
text: Their pizza and hoagies are good but don't quite measure up to other Mellows.  The service is young and easily overwhelmed; I was sad to witness the bartender being rude to an older party in town to watch their daughter play a game.  Yes, ‚Ä¶More

name: Mark Joseph
text: Almost as nice as the Cary location.  On a recent visit two of five orders were incorrect/late.  Management did follow up and comp one of the meals.

name: Katie Donahue
text: Awesome food and great service

name: Aidan Gray
text: A bit pricey for the quality of the pizza. Not as unique or quirky now, just another pizza chain.

name: Ryan McCune
text: Great place to eat with the kids.

name: Amber Jones
text: Very good staff was very friendly

name: Stevie Downs
text: Family friendly. A bit loud. Good beer selection.

name: Robert Quackenbush
text: If I can give 0 stars I would. No parking, terrible staff, I left before inrevieved food. Aweful.

name: John Mader
text: Made a trip to the Daily Buffet of pizza and salad. First let me say the service was friendly and responsive. The salad was tired, if not exhausted. The pizza crust was soft and oily. To be fair, I have been spoiled by the excellent pizzas of Napoli food truck and Mercato.

name: Matt Clements
text: Great pizza joint with excellent beer choices and plenty of parking in the back lot

name: Michael Morbitzer
text: Great food. A little pricey.

name: Emily Meier
text: I love how many vegan options they have here. Food took quite a while, but very delicious. Expensive, but the way the quality is, it's worth it.

name: Patricia St John
text: Awesome service. Fast. Friendly.

name: robyn dorton
text: It was good.

name: Syed Osama Ahmad
text: Awful pizza the lunch buffet is not worth it, never going there again

name: Sifron Benjamin
text: Friendly staff and good food. Can have a pretty long wait.

name: Sasquatch Kestner
text: Bartenders know there beer and the guys in back know good pizza. Definitely a stop while near Franklin St.

name: Matt H
text: Mellow Mushroom has some of the worst tasting pizza I've ever eaten. You get much better quality at any other store, even chains like Pizza Hut.

name: Barrel Titor
text: Tried the meat-lover pizza, it's a decent pizza but you can get the same quality at half the price at literally most of the other 5 or 6 pizza places on franklin

name: Ronnie Shvueli
text: Can‚Äôt find pizza this good anymore and the service is fantastic!

name: Matt Mould
text: This place was awesome!  I got a 1/2 house and 1/2 Holy Shittaki (sp?) and it was delicious.  My waitress was pleasant and engaging and the environment was perfect (Beck, Cake, et cetera played on the radio) - I highly recommend Mellow Mushroom.

name: Christopher Brown
text: Great service at this location. Make sure to park in the parking lot in the rear, otherwise you'll be towed!

name: David Williams
text: Excellent pizza and service.

name: Paul Clark
text: Great place to have a pizza with the family, and separately, a great place to grab a beer and catch up with friends.

name: Carter Glogowski
text: Great pizza, but a bit pricey

name: Amy Graham
text: The staff is great, the food amazing, and the beer fantastic! What more could you ask for?

name: D. G.
text: Good pizza, tons of options. The night of our service was a bit inept, and they were dragging tables around behind us with a horrible screeching nose Ave didn't mind our looks of disapproval.

name: Rob Reece
text: Update 3/2018:  Mellow has fallen off a bit.  I think it started when a particular female manager left (don't know her name). She used to care, she would visit the table every time I ate there and check how things were.  The servers were ‚Ä¶More

name: Patrick Heaney
text: Great vegan options. Great people. (Men's room needs a diaper changing station.)

name: James Williams
text: Weekday Lunch Buffet is a great deal!

name: isha gupta
text: Cozy place with friendly staff and good pizzas and subs!

name: Jerry Yu
text: Nice environment for yummy pizza

name: Dalton M
text: Our waiter, Justin, was super duper cool and provided us with interesting facts about the history of Mellow Shroom. Pizza was okay on the buffet.

name: Jeff Mecham
text: Definitely the most underwhelming Mellow Mushroom I've ever visited. Been twice, won't be back. Total bummer add this is a great brand that usually has GREAT food!

name: Todd Gregory
text: Always have great service and food is consistent. The change the menu often, so always worth a trip back.

name: Barry Smith
text: Great pizza, great service.

name: Paul Langan
text: Happy with service quality.  Very friendly wait team.  Sandwich I ordered was very tasty. Teriyaki tempeh hoagie with side of roasted potatoes is a favorite whenever I find myself at a Mellow Mushroom.  Pizzas and Hoagies (see subs) are consistently good when one finds a Mellow Mushroom.

name: Robert Newton
text: Always good. New buffet is great.

name: Treesa Ouseph
text: I really like the set up of this location and the staff is super friendly.

name: Alexis Girault
text: Good for families. Their pizza is okay, but for the same price you can get better at IP3 or at the pizza truck in front of Harris Teeter in Carborro, both being really close.

name: Clinton Branson
text: So many good options, I could eat here everyday.

name: Carson Scercy
text: The pizza here is delicious. It's a little expensive, one small pizza, appetizer, and drinks comes out to 25 ish dollars, but the pizzas are so well crafted and have so many unique toppings it's worth it. I'd recommend the holy shiitake ‚Ä¶More

name: Ansel Rosso Klakovich
text: Good pizza although a bit pricey.

name: Tiffanie Watkins
text: Great good and great service! Really enjoyed it.

name: Ben Selvage
text: I have heard a lot about this place and my first experience was very good.  They have a lot of different pizzas to try and they usually have a Groupon you can get that costs $15 and when you present it in the restaraunt, they take $25 off your bill.

name: James Haworth
text: Awesome food at a good price

name: dan b
text: Great tasting pizza, but the dough can be a little too doughy.
